publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7792 Bill Kidd: Independent Living Fund Suffers Westminster’s Axe—That the Parliament expresses concern regarding the UK Government’s decision to axe the Independent Living Fund, which enables disabled people to live on their own; notes that the fund has given more than £60 million to help thousands of disabled people to live independently; further notes that thousands of people in Scotland have been aided by the fund; denounces the UK Government’s decision to bar further applicants and remove funding to those already covered at the end of the current parliament, and condemns the UK Government’s attack on those whom it considers to be the most vulnerable in society.

S3M-7792 Independent Living Fund Suffers Westminster’s Axe (lodged on 25 January 2011) Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Jamie Hepburn*, Dave Thompson*, John Wilson*, Brian Adam*, Bob Doris*, Jackie Baillie*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bill Wilson*, Rob Gibson*, Ian McKee*
S3M-7792 Independent Living Fund Suffers Westminster’s Axe (lodged on 25 January 2011) Gil Paterson*
